intro: Soranthe clavigera, commonly known as the spiked soranthe, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
